alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McCulloch and southern San Saba Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fredonia, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherokee, Camp San Saba, Calf Creek, Chappel, Voca and The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1311. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
